name: maskfilter
description:
Perform filtering operations on 3D / 4D mask images.

The available filters are: clean, connect, dilate, erode, median.

Each filter has its own unique set of optional parameters.

References:
author: MRTrix3 Developers

inputs.name: input
inputs.description: the input image.

inputs.name: filter
inputs.description: the type of filter to be applied (clean, connect, dilate, erode, median)

inputs.name: output
inputs.description: the output image.

inputs.name: scale
inputs.description: the maximum scale used to cut bridges. A certain maximum scale cuts bridges up to a width (in voxels) of 2x the provided scale. (Default: 2)

inputs.name: axes
inputs.description: specify which axes should be included in the connected components. By default only the first 3 axes are included. The axes should be provided as a comma-separated list of values.

inputs.name: largest
inputs.description: only retain the largest connected component

inputs.name: connectivity
inputs.description: use 26-voxel-neighbourhood connectivity (Default: 6)

inputs.name: npass
inputs.description: the number of times to repeatedly apply the filter

inputs.name: extent
inputs.description: specify the extent (width) of kernel size in voxels. This can be specified either as a single value to be used for all axes, or as a comma-separated list of the extent for each axis. The default is 3x3x3.

inputs.name: strides
inputs.description: specify the strides of the output data in memory; either as a comma-separated list of (signed) integers, or as a template image from which the strides shall be extracted and used. The actual strides produced will depend on whether the output image format can support it.

inputs.name: Object
inputs.description: String object.

inputs.name: Object
inputs.description: File object.

inputs.name: info
inputs.description: display information messages.

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: display debugging messages.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).
